meanings.definition: Lights seen on the Earth's surface at night.
meanings.sent1: The earthlights twinkled in the darkness, guiding us home.
meanings.sent2: The city's earthlights shimmered under the starry sky.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fireflies pretended to be earthlights, confusing the travelers.
meanings.sent4: The earthlights danced like fireflies on the ground, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent5: The earthlights painted a beautiful picture of the night landscape.

meanings.definition: A phenomenon caused by natural or man-made sources of light on Earth.
meanings.sent1: The earthlights from the city obscured the view of the stars.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious earthlights in the forest puzzled the researchers.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage made the earthlights disappear, leaving everyone in awe.
meanings.sent4: The earthlights of the city were like a beacon in the night, guiding lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The earthlights of the carnival lit up the night sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The glow or illumination of the Earth's surface.
meanings.sent1: The earthlights of the city created a warm glow in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The earthlights of the town were visible even from afar.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon mistook the earthlights for daylight and stayed up all night.
meanings.sent4: The earthlights of the metropolis never truly faded, even in the darkest hours.
meanings.sent5: The earthlights of the countryside were a comforting sight after a long journey.
